actions.text: Committee on Foreign Relations ordered to be reported an original measure.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Kassebaum with a preamble. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 476.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

official_title: An original resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the furnishing of assistance for the Republic of Liberia, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the October 15, 1985, election in the Republic of Liberia does not meet specified requirements of the International Security and Development Cooperation Act of 1985; (2) the President should channel future economic assistance to Liberia through nongovernmental organizations; and (3) the President should suspend military assistance to Liberia until that country releases all political prisoners, provides free elections, and establishes a civil government. Declares that the Senate expresses U.S. friendship to the people of Liberia and the desire of the United States for the establishment of democracy in that country.

titles.title: An original resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the furnishing of assistance for the Republic of Liberia, and for other purposes.
